meanings.definition: To convert into a mineral substance.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was mineralizing the rock samples in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The buried bones were slowly mineralizing over time.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion had an unexpected effect, mineralizing everything it touched.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to mineralize his heart, turning it into stone.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes mineralized the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The organic matter was mineralizing in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tree stump was mineralizing and becoming part of the earth.
meanings.sent3: The old pirate's tale told of a ship that mysteriously mineralized at sea.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant colors of the painting mineralized into muted tones over time.
meanings.sent5: The sunken ship was slowly mineralizing on the ocean floor, becoming a part of the underwater landscape.

meanings.sent1: The mineralizing of the cave walls created stunning crystal formations.
meanings.sent2: The mineralizing of the water resulted in the formation of precious gemstones.
meanings.sent3: The mineralizing of the soil was essential for the growth of healthy plants.
meanings.sent4: The mineralizing of the volcanic ash led to the creation of new mineral deposits.
meanings.sent5: The mineralizing of the rock layers took millions of years to complete, forming intricate patterns.
